ui

Class StatusBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • ui.StatusBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class StatusBar
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The StatusBar class is responsible for displaying the small bar at the bottom of the program window. It displays the most recent initial conditions found by the user by clicking on the plot, a message window for communicating important messages or status updates to the user, and a progress bar to be enabled whenever the program is running a significantly long operation. The StatusBar class has methods to change the message display and activate/ de-activate the (indeterminate) progress bar, as well as for updating the point display.
    Author:
    Clinic 08-09
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StatusBar()
      Default Constructor, constructs a status bar for the bottom of the program window, containing a display of the point clicked by the user, a message label for communicating program activity to the user, and an indeterminate progress bar to indicate program activity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StatusBar

        public StatusBar()
        Default Constructor, constructs a status bar for the bottom of the program window, containing a display of the point clicked by the user, a message label for communicating program activity to the user, and an indeterminate progress bar to indicate program activity.

    • Method Detail

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy()
        Returns the status of the progress bar. So that multiple-step operations display a smooth progress bar animation, this method gives a process the ability to leave the progress bar as it was when one sub-process is finished.
        Returns:
        true iff the status of the progress bar is set to busy

      • setBusy

        public void setBusy(boolean busy)
        Enables/disables the progress bar. The progress bar is always set to indeterminate to indicate that the program is working, but no completion percentage will be shown.
        Parameters:
        busy - whether the progress bar shown be shown as busy

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Setter for the message display.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to display

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(java.lang.String msg,
             boolean busy)
        This method allows for the program to update the status display (message + progress bar) in a one line-call.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to display
        busy - whether the progress bar should be shown as busy

      • updatePoint

        public void updatePoint(double x,
               double y)
        When the user clicks on the graph, this function is called to update the point displayed on the status bar. Note that this does not support scientific notation.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the initial condition set
        y - the y-coordinate of the initial condition set
